### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Levamisole is correctly used as an anthelmintic effective in single doses for ascariasis, and as an immunostimulant. It causes paralysis of worms by depolarization, not hyperpolarization. There is no consensus supporting its use as an immunodepressant at high doses; this is a misunderstanding of its potential overstimulation effects on the immune system.
